Forrest Gump.passage: For his performance in the role of Forrest Gump, Tom Hanks was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actor and the Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Motion Picture Drama. He won the BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role, and the Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role. Forrest Gump was the first film to receive the Academy Award for Best Picture—the highest honor in cinematic achievement—as well as Best Actor and Best Original Score. The film was also nominated for the Academy Award for Best Director for Barry Levinson. It won two more Oscars for Best Film Editing and Best Sound. The film was selected for preservation in the United States National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as being \"culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant\". The film was released on June 6, 1994, to critical acclaim and was a commercial success. It became the second-highest-grossing film worldwide of 1994, behind only The Lion King. In 1997, the film was adapted into a novel of the same name by Eric Roth, which was followed by a sequel, Gump and Co. in 1999, and a prequel, Forrest Gump: A Glory of the Game, in 2005. The film is noted for its depiction of several important historical events in the 20th century.

The Godfather.passage: The Godfather is a 1972 American crime film directed by Francis Ford Coppola and produced by Albert S. Ruddy. The film stars Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan and Robert De Niro in their first film roles. It is the first installment in The Godfather film series, and is based on the 1969 novel of the same name by Mario Puzo. Set in New York City, New York, the story follows the Corleone crime family, led by patriarch Michael Corleone, as he attempts to preserve and expand its power and influence in the face of rival gangs, the police and government agencies. The Godfather is widely considered to be one of the greatest and most influential films in cinematic history. It is the only one of the Godfather films to win the Academy Award for Best Picture. It was also nominated for Best Director for Coppola, Best Adapted Screenplay for Puzo and Coppola, and Best Supporting Actress for De Niro. It spawned two sequels, The Godfather Part II in 1974 and The Godfather Part III in 1990, as well as several other adaptations, including video games, a comic book, and a television miniseries. The film's success helped to establish the genres of crime films, mafia films and gangster films. It also helped to re-establish Brando's career and made Pacino a leading star.

The Lord of the Rings.passage: The Lord of the Rings is a high fantasy novel written in English by English author J. R. R. Tolkien, set in the fictional world of Middle-earth, which he created. It was first published in three volumes between 1954 and 1955. The story begins with the wizard Gandalf and his protégé, the hobbit Frodo Baggins, leaving the Shire and venturing into the Old World, where they soon come across the wizard Saruman and the palantír of Orthanc. They then go on to destroy the One Ring, a powerful Ring that had been crafted by the Dark Lord Sauron. The One Ring had originally been forged so as to control the other rings, and thereby rule all of Middle-earth. After the destruction of the One Ring, Sauron's spirit was imprisoned for a thousand years within the Ring. In Tolkien's fictional universe, the One Ring was destroyed at the end of "The Lord of the Rings". However, Tolkien's works have inspired many other fictional works, some of which have also been made into films and television series.

Saruman is based upon a character of the same name in The Hobbit and The Silmarillion, but Tolkien also developed the character in response to the events of World War I, which he witnessed in person. Joseph Gordon-Levitt.passage: Joseph Gordon-Levitt ( ; born December 3, 1982) is an American actor and filmmaker. He began his career as a child actor, making his film debut in the 1994 comedy film "3 Ninjas". He played the lead roles in the films "10 Things I Hate About You" (1999), "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" (TV) (2001–2003) and "Inception" (2010). Gordon-Levitt's breakthrough role was as a troubled high school student in the drama "Mysterious Skin" (2004). He received critical acclaim for his performance in the drama "(500) Days of Summer" (2009), for which he received the BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role. Gordon-Levitt achieved wider recognition for his leading role as a web-slinging superhero in the science fiction action film "The Dark Knight Rises" (2012). He subsequently gained recognition for his leading roles in the comedy-dramas "(500) Days of Summer" (2009), "50/50" (2014) and the crime film "3rd Person" (2013), and for his portrayal of a young astronaut in the drama "Looper" (2012).

Christopher Nolan's.passage:
Christopher Nolan (born 1970) is an English filmmaker, screenwriter, and producer. He is the founder of the film production company Syncopy Inc.
and has collaborated with film-maker Hans Zimmer on many of his films since 1995's Batman. Nolan is known for his meticulous, fastidious approach to filmmaking. He has been described as one of Hollywood's most respected filmmakers, and is frequently cited as an influence by filmmakers such as Quentin Tarantino, Martin Scorsese, Steven Spielberg, Ridley Scott, Sam Mendes, James Mangold, and Joe and Anthony Russo, who have named Nolan among their favorite directors. Nolan's films explore themes of isolation, powerlessness, and the dehumanization of man, and are noted for their dark visual style, tight editing, extensive use of symbolism, long takes, and sound design. He frequently collaborates with cinematographer Wally Pfister and frequent composer Hans Zimmer. Nolan has been nominated for the BAFTA Award for Best Direction three times, winning the award twice. He is the only person to have won the BAFTA Award for Best Direction for a non-episodic television series.

qae_pairs.question: What is Christopher Nolan's company?
qae_pairs.explanation: Christopher Nolan is the founder of the film production company Syncopy Inc.

Selina Kyle / Catwoman.passage: Selina Kyle / Catwoman is a fictional character, a supervillain appearing in American comic books published by DC Comics. Created by Bill Finger and Bob Kane, the character first appeared in Batman #1 (Spring 1940). She is a cat burglar and occasional ally of Batman and Catwoman, and a nemesis of Batman ally, Robin. Selina Kyle is the alias of Selina Frances Kyle, the daughter of an abusive and corrupt billionaire, who adopts a secret life as a cat burglar. She is first introduced as the love interest and partner of Bruce Wayne, and later as the nemesis of Dick Grayson (Robin). She is also known as Catwoman, a criminal persona she adopts. She is also known as the "Cat" and the "Kitt". Selina Kyle is loosely based on actress Thelma Todd, who was murdered in her home by her husband in 1935. In the 1989 film Batman, she was portrayed by Michelle Pfeiffer. In the 2004 film Batman Begins, she was portrayed by Katie Holmes. In the television series Gotham, she is portrayed by Zabryna Guevara. In the comics, Selina is a highly skilled thief, capable of breaking into high-security facilities and outsmarting Batman. She is also a skilled martial artist and hand-to-hand combatant.
